System: You are a helpful radix-ui-themes expert.

User: How do I examples in radix-ui-themes?

Assistant: To examples in radix-ui-themes, here's what you do:
### [Size](https://www.radix-ui.com/themes/docs/components/text-field#size)
Use the `size` prop to control the size.

```jsx
<Flex direction="column" gap="3">
	<Box maxWidth="200px">
		<TextField.Root size="1" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
	</Box>
	<Box maxWidth="250px">
		<TextField.Root size="2" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
	</Box>
	<Box maxWidth="300px">
		<TextField.Root size="3" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
	</Box>
</Flex>
```

Use matching component sizes when composing Text Field with buttons. However, don’t use size 1 inputs with buttons—at this size, there is not enough vertical space to nest other interactive elements.

```jsx
<Flex direction="column" gap="3" maxWidth="400px">
	<Box maxWidth="200px">
		<TextField.Root placeholder="Search the docs…" size="1">
			<TextField.Slot>
				<MagnifyingGlassIcon height="16" width="16" />
			</TextField.Slot>
		</TextField.Root>
	</Box>
	<Box maxWidth="250px">
		<TextField.Root placeholder="Search the docs…" size="2">
			<TextField.Slot>
				<MagnifyingGlassIcon height="16" width="16" />
			</TextField.Slot>
			<TextField.Slot>
				<IconButton size="1" variant="ghost">
					<DotsHorizontalIcon height="14" width="14" />
				</IconButton>
			</TextField.Slot>
		</TextField.Root>
	</Box>
	<Box maxWidth="300px">
		<TextField.Root placeholder="Search the docs…" size="3">
			<TextField.Slot>
				<MagnifyingGlassIcon height="16" width="16" />
			</TextField.Slot>
			<TextField.Slot pr="3">
				<IconButton size="2" variant="ghost">
					<DotsHorizontalIcon height="16" width="16" />
				</IconButton>
			</TextField.Slot>
		</TextField.Root>
	</Box>
</Flex>
```

### [Variant](https://www.radix-ui.com/themes/docs/components/text-field#variant)
Use the `variant` prop to control the visual style.

```jsx
<Flex direction="column" gap="3" maxWidth="250px">
	<TextField.Root variant="surface" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
	<TextField.Root variant="classic" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
	<TextField.Root variant="soft" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
</Flex>
```

### [Color](https://www.radix-ui.com/themes/docs/components/text-field#color)
Use the `color` prop to assign a specific [color](https://www.radix-ui.com/themes/docs/theme/color).

```jsx
<Flex direction="column" gap="3" maxWidth="250px">
	<TextField.Root
		color="indigo"
		variant="soft"
		placeholder="Search the docs…"
	/> 
	<TextField.Root color="green" variant="soft" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
	<TextField.Root color="red" variant="soft" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
</Flex>
```

### [Radius](https://www.radix-ui.com/themes/docs/components/text-field#radius)
Use the `radius` prop to assign a specific radius value.

```jsx
<Flex direction="column" gap="3" maxWidth="250px">
	<TextField.Root radius="none" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
	<TextField.Root radius="large" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
	<TextField.Root radius="full" placeholder="Search the docs…" />
</Flex>
```.
Pretty straightforward, right?

System: You are a helpful radix-ui-themes expert.

User: Can you explain what Radix UI Themes Documentation is in radix-ui-themes?

Assistant: Sure, I'd be happy to explain Radix UI Themes Documentation in radix-ui-themes.

# Radix UI Themes Documentation

Comprehensive documentation for Radix UI themes, including components, utilities, and styling guidelines.Here's a quick rundown of what this is about:

## Overview

This section provides an introduction to the Radix UI themes, including links to getting started, styling, layout, releases, and resources.

## Theme

Details about the theme structure, including color, dark mode, typography, spacing, breakpoints, radius, and shadows.

## Layout

Information on layout components such as Box, Flex, Grid, Container, and Section.

## Typography

Guidelines for typography components including Text, Heading, Blockquote, Code, Em, Kbd, Link, Quote, and Strong.

## Components

A comprehensive list of UI components available in Radix UI, including Alert Dialog, Avatar, Button, Card, Checkbox, Dialog, Dropdown Menu, and more.

## Utilities

Overview of utility components like Accessible Icon, Portal, Reset, Slot, Theme, and Visually Hidden.

## Visually Hidden

Hides content from the screen in an accessible way. Includes links to view source and report issues.

## API Reference

This component inherits all props and functionality from the Visually Hidden primitive utility.

This should give you a solid starting point!

# Radix UI Themes Documentation

Comprehensive documentation for Radix UI themes, including components, utilities, and styling guidelines.Here's a quick rundown of what this is about:

## Overview

This section provides an introduction to the Radix UI themes, including links to getting started, styling, layout, releases, and resources.

## Theme

Details about theme customization, including color, dark mode, typography, spacing, breakpoints, radius, and shadows.

## Layout

Information on layout components such as Box, Flex, Grid, Container, and Section.

## Typography

Guidelines for typography components including Text, Heading, Blockquote, Code, Em, Kbd, Link, Quote, and Strong.

## Components

A comprehensive list of UI components available in Radix UI themes, including Alert Dialog, Avatar, Button, Checkbox, Dialog, Dropdown Menu, and more.

## Utilities

Utilities provided by Radix UI themes, including Accessible Icon, Portal, Reset, Slot, Theme, and Visually Hidden.

## Accessible Icon

Makes icons accessible by adding a label. This section includes a link to view the source code and report issues.

## API Reference

This component inherits all props and functionality from the Accessible Icon primitive utility.

This should give you a solid starting point!

# Radix UI Themes Documentation

Comprehensive documentation for Radix UI themes, including components, layout, typography, and utilities.Here's a quick rundown of what this is about:

## Overview

This section provides an introduction to the Radix UI themes, including links to getting started, styling, layout, releases, and resources.

## Theme

Details about the theme configuration, including color, dark mode, typography, spacing, breakpoints, radius, and shadows.

## Layout

Information on layout components such as Box, Flex, Grid, Container, and Section.

## Typography

Guidelines for typography components including Text, Heading, Blockquote, Code, Em, Kbd, Link, Quote, and Strong.

## Components

A list of available components in Radix UI themes, including Alert Dialog, Aspect Ratio, Avatar, Badge, Button, Callout, Card, Checkbox, Checkbox Group, Checkbox Cards, Context Menu, Data List, Dialog, Dropdown Menu, Hover Card, Icon Button, Inset, Popover, Progress, Radio, Radio Group, Radio Cards, Scroll Area, Segmented Control, Select, Separator, Skeleton, Slider, Spinner, Switch, Table, Tabs, Tab Nav, Text Area, Text Field, and Tooltip.

## Utilities

Utilities provided by Radix UI themes, including Accessible Icon, Portal, Reset, Slot, Theme, and Visually Hidden.

## Aspect Ratio

Displays content within a desired ratio. This section includes a code example, a link to the source code, and a link to report issues.

This should give you a solid starting point!

System: You are a helpful radix-ui-themes expert.

User: Can you give me some code examples for Radix UI Themes Documentation in radix-ui-themes?

Assistant: Absolutely! Here are some practical examples to help you out:

**Badge Example**:

```yaml
<Flex gap="2">
	<Badge color="orange">In progress</Badge>
	<Badge color="blue">In review</Badge>
	<Badge color="green">Complete</Badge>
</Flex>
```

This snippet shows you how to badge example, which is an important aspect of radix ui themes documentation.

**Size Example**:

```yaml
<Flex align="center" gap="2">
	<Badge size="1" color="indigo">New</Badge>
	<Badge size="2" color="indigo">New</Badge>
	<Badge size="3" color="indigo">New</Badge>
</Flex>
```

This snippet shows you how to size example, which is an important aspect of radix ui themes documentation.

**Variant Example**:

```yaml
<Flex gap="2">
	<Badge variant="solid" color="indigo">New</Badge>
	<Badge variant="soft" color="indigo">New</Badge>
	<Badge variant="surface" color="indigo">New</Badge>
	<Badge variant="outline" color="indigo">New</Badge>
</Flex>
```

This snippet shows you how to variant example, which is an important aspect of radix ui themes documentation.

**Color Example**:

```yaml
<Flex gap="2">
	<Badge color="indigo">New</Badge>
	<Badge color="cyan">New</Badge>
	<Badge color="orange">New</Badge>
	<Badge color="crimson">New</Badge>
</Flex>
```

This snippet shows you how to color example, which is an important aspect of radix ui themes documentation.

**High-contrast Example**:

```yaml
<Flex direction="column" gap="2">
	<Flex gap="2">
		<Badge color="gray" variant="solid">New</Badge>
		<Badge color="gray" variant="soft">New</Badge>
		<Badge color="gray" variant="surface">New</Badge>
		<Badge color="gray" variant="outline">New</Badge>
	</Flex>
	<Flex gap="2">
		<Badge color="gray" variant="solid" highContrast>New</Badge>

## Utilities

This section includes utility components like Accessible Icon, Portal, Reset, Slot, Theme, and Visually Hidden.

## Components - Box

## API Reference

System: You are a helpful radix-ui-themes expert.

User: What are some tips for using Radix UI Themes Documentation in radix-ui-themes effectively?

Assistant: Great question! Here are some tips to keep in mind:

Use the `as` prop to render text as different HTML elements for semantic purposes.

Choose appropriate text sizes (2-4) for long-form content to enhance readability.

Utilize the `weight` prop to emphasize important text.

Align text properly using the `align` prop for better layout.

Trim leading and trailing spaces using the `trim` prop for cleaner appearance.

Use the `truncate` prop to handle overflow text gracefully.

Select colors that provide sufficient contrast for accessibility.

Stick to these, and you'll avoid a lot of headaches!

# Radix UI Themes Documentation

Comprehensive documentation for Radix UI themes, including components, layout, typography, and utilities.Here's a quick rundown of what this is about:

## Overview

This section provides links to getting started, styling, layout, releases, and resources.

## Theme

This section covers theme-related topics such as overview, color, dark mode, typography, spacing, breakpoints, radius, shadows, and cursors.

## Layout

This section includes layout components like Box, Flex, Grid, Container, and Section.

## Typography

This section details typography components including Text, Heading, Blockquote, Code, Em, Kbd, Link, Quote, and Strong.

## Components

This section lists various components such as Alert Dialog, Aspect Ratio, Avatar, Badge, Button, Callout, Card, Checkbox, Checkbox Group, Checkbox Cards, Context Menu, Data List, Dialog, Dropdown Menu, Hover Card, Icon Button, Inset, Popover, Progress, Radio, Radio Group, Radio Cards, Scroll Area, Segmented Control, Select, Separator, Skeleton, Slider, Spinner, Switch, Table, Tabs, Tab Nav, Text Area, Text Field, and Tooltip.

## Utilities

This section includes utility components like Accessible Icon, Portal, Reset, Slot, Theme, and Visually Hidden.

## Quote

Short inline quotation. This section includes a famous quote by Massimo, along with its source and links to report issues or view in the playground.

## API Reference

This section provides details about the API for the Quote component, including props and their types.

## Examples

This section provides examples of how to use the Quote component, including a specific example of using the truncate prop.

This should give you a solid starting point!

This should give you a solid starting point!

## Overview

This section provides links to various topics including Getting Started, Styling, Layout, Releases, and Resources.

## Theme

This section covers the theme aspects of Radix UI, including Color, Dark mode, Typography, Spacing, Breakpoints, Radius, Shadows, and Cursors.

## Layout

This section discusses layout components such as Box, Flex, Grid, Container, and Section.

## Typography

Guidance for using and tuning typography, including base components, typographic principles, formatting components, type scale, font weight, font family, customization, and advanced settings.

## Components

This section lists various components available in Radix UI, including Alert Dialog, Avatar, Button, Card, Checkbox, Dialog, Dropdown Menu, and more.

## Utilities

This section covers utility components such as Accessible Icon, Portal, Reset, Slot, Theme, and Visually Hidden.

This should give you a solid starting point!

User: What are some tips for using Radix UI Themes Documentation in radix-ui-themes effectively?

Assistant: Great question! Here are some tips to keep in mind:

Ensure consistent typography by using Text and Heading components with shared props.

Customize typography by overriding CSS variables for font family and weight.

Be aware of CSS import order issues when using custom fonts with next/font.

Stick to these, and you'll avoid a lot of headaches!
